New Records: Evan Mobley scored a season-high 34 points and grabbed 10 rebounds, extending the Cavaliers' winning streak to nine games
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers used a 20-point run to turn a 21-17 deficit into a 37-21 lead early in the second quarter
Cleveland's 18-0 advantage in first-half turnover points was a key factor
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks were shorthanded without All-Star guards Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving due to injury and calf strain respectively
The Cavaliers were on a four-game Western Conference road trip and were 10-0 against the West
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers extended their winning streak to nine games, matching a season low with eight total turnovers
The Mavericks' losing streak reached four consecutive games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers led by as many as 27 points at some point during the game
The Mavericks' bench players contributed 44 points, led by Quentin Grimes and Jaden Hardy
